misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of SHA-1 hash algorithm is considered broken and should not be used for cryptographic purposes. It has been shown to be vulnerable to collisions, which can lead to a variety of attacks, including impersonation and manipulation of data.
recommendation: Use a stronger and more secure hash algorithm, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512, instead of SHA-1.
